required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Skin Care Product in Aging Facial Skin
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Arm, Open-Label, Single Center Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of P29429-01 in Aging Facial Skin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of P29429-01 as a skin care product to manage skin aging in women subjects 40-65 years of age.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background and Rationale:
Skin aging, a major concern for females, is closely associated with factors including genetics, age and UV exposure.
Its first signs include reduced epidermal and dermal thickness, reduced water content in the stratum corneum causing the "dry look" of skin.
The ability of dermal fibroblasts to synthesize collagen fibers is reduced bring the decreased collagen content, and the intradermal elastic fibers are denatured and lose elasticity. The extracellular matrix of the dermis, such as hyaluronic acid, are also decreasing year by year.
These are the primary causes of wrinkle formation, loosening and drooping. The anti-aging product used in this study, P29429-01, is developed and manufactured by Orient EuroPharma. Its main ingredients include Hesperetin, a citrus bioflavonoid of antioxidant activity extracted from citrus peel. It is widely used in cosmetic products. Sodium cyclic lysophosphatidic acid, a substance extracted from soybean, increases hyaluronic acid and collagen synthesis in the skin to achieve hydration and anti-aging.
In this study, subjects are subject to a 4-week washout period before using P29429-01 on full face twice a day for 12-week. A skin analyzer is used to obtain skin aging indices to assess the efficacy and safety of P29429-01.
Study Purpose:
The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of P29429-01 as a skin care product to manage skin aging in women subjects 40-65 years of age who show manifestations of facial skin aging. Subjects are to undergo a 4-week washout period before using P29429-01 on the face for 12 weeks. A skin analyzer is used to obtain skin aging indices for said assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: Facial skin hydration change from baseline
primary_outcome.description: Corneum hydration of the skin will be determined using CK's Corneometry

primary_outcome.measure: Facial skin elasticity change from baseline
primary_outcome.description: Elasticity of the skin will be determined using CK's Cutometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial spots change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess facial skin spots with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial pores change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess pore size with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial wrinkles change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess wrinkles with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial texture change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess texture with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial porphyrin (from Propionibacterium acnes) change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess porphyrin values with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial brown spots change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess brown spots with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial red area change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess red area with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial UV spots change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Assess UV spots with VISIA advanced skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sebumeter values change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measure sebum (oil) on the skin with CK skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mexameter values change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measure melanin content on the skin with CK skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Transepidermal water loss (TEWL) by tewameter change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Transepidermal water loss (TEWL) with CK skin tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial skin wrinkles change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Obtain and assess wrinkles with Antera 3D tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial skin texture change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Obtain and assess texture with Antera 3D tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial skin pore change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Obtain and assess pore size with Antera 3D tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial skin depression/elevation change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Obtain and assess depression/elevation with Antera 3D tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial skin melanin values change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Obtain and assess melanin values with Antera 3D tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Facial skin hemoglobin values change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Obtain and assess hemoglobin values with Antera 3D tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the safety of P29429-01 as a skin care product
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the incidence of adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the safety of P29429-01 as a skin care product with skin health questionnaires
secondary_outcome.description: The skin health questionnaires is an ordinal scale used to assess the skin health, such as skin inflammation ,red, scaling, itchy, and achy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Study compliance of the subjects
secondary_outcome.description: Assess with phone calls and clinic visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess P29429-01 satisfaction of the subjects with satisfaction questionnaires
secondary_outcome.description: The satisfaction questionnaires is a Likert scale used to assess satisfaction of the subjects, such as improvement of facial skin hydration, elasticity, wrinkles, texture and appearance.

secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of P29429-01 in increasing hyaluronic acid, collagen and elastic fiber using skin tissue biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: For subjects agreeing to provide a skin tissue biopsy, the skin biopsy is obtained from a small area on the medial side of the forearm.

arm_group.description: Women subjects 40-65 years of age that meet the specified inclusion/exclusion criteria taking P29429-01 as a skin care product per the protocol.

intervention.description: Primary Subjects will use P29429-01 as an anti-aging skin care product on full face twice a day for 12-week.

reference.citation: Black MM. A modified radiographic method for measuring skin thickness. Br J Dermatol. 1969 Sep;81(9):661-6.
Uitto J, Fazio MJ, Olsen DR. Molecular mechanisms of cutaneous aging. Age-associated connective tissue alterations in the dermis. J Am Acad Dermatol. 1989 Sep;21(3 Pt 2):614-22. Review.

Melchini A, Catania S, Stancanelli R, Tommasini S, Costa C. Interaction of a functionalized complex of the flavonoid hesperetin with the AhR pathway and CYP1A1 expression: involvement in its protective effects against benzo[a]pyrene-induced oxidative stress in human skin. Cell Biol Toxicol. 2011 Oct;27(5):371-9. doi: 10.1007/s10565-011-9194-6. Epub 2011 Jul 1.
